intro: Asperula hirsuta var. baetica, commonly known as the Baetican hirsute woodruff, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy, creeping stems and trifoliate leaves, which are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine make it a notable species in Mediterranean botany.
